private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are vowels (A, E, I, O, U).
I can only interact with blocks that are on the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time and only onto the table or onto another top block.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on O, and O is on the table.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are consonants.
I can only interact with blocks that are on the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time and only onto the table or onto another top block.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on O, and O is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a single integrated PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieves the goal and is compatible with the FastDownwards (Fast Downward) planner.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labeled blocks: L, F, K, I, J, C, O, N, H, E, D, B, M, G, A.
Only the top block of any stack may be picked up or moved.
Agents may move one block at a time and may place a block either on the table or on top of another top block.
Initial stacks are two stacks on the table: stack1 base L with blocks above it in order L, I, C, O, N, H, B, A (A is top); stack2 base F with blocks above it in order F, K, J, E, D, M, G (G is top).
The desired final configuration is a single stack with O on the table and the rest stacked above it in order O, N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A (A top).
One agent is restricted to moving vowel-labeled blocks and the other to moving consonant-labeled blocks.
All agents share the same global goal of achieving the specified final configuration.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an autonomous block-manipulation agent that can only move vowel-labeled blocks. You understand blockstacking rules and can report which top-accessible vowel blocks you can move and propose local move sequences for those blocks to help achieve a global stacking goal.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Given the public information about the world and your private constraints that you can only move vowels and only top blocks, list all currently top-accessible vowel blocks, describe for each a sequence of allowed single-block moves you can perform now or after other moves by other agents, and provide any preconditions or dependencies your moves require from the other agent. Keep responses actionable, structured, and do not emit PDDL.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an autonomous block-manipulation agent that can only move consonant-labeled blocks. You understand blockstacking rules and can report which top-accessible consonant blocks you can move and propose local move sequences for those blocks to help achieve a global stacking goal.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Given the public information about the world and your private constraints that you can only move consonants and only top blocks, list all currently top-accessible consonant blocks, describe for each a sequence of allowed single-block moves you can perform now or after other moves by other agents, and provide any preconditions or dependencies your moves require from the other agent. Keep responses actionable, structured, and do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and must produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. You will integrate the local analyses from the agents, keep agent actions distinct, and produce a single cohesive domain and problem that encodes the block-moving capabilities, agent-specific action permissions (vowel vs consonant), the initial two-stack configuration, and the target single-stack goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the public world description and the move analyses from the two agents provided as inputs. Keep the actions of vowel_agent and consonant_agent distinct in the domain (for example, prefix or type-actions so the planner knows which agent can execute which action). Ensure the domain encodes that only top blocks are movable and that each agent can only move its allowed letters. Generate a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem instance that represent the initial two stacks and the final required single stack, and ensure the PDDL is compatible with and tuned for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> and set the domain/problem to use STRIPS-like definitions appropriate for classical FastDownwards planning.
